content.description: The distribution of long jump distance in a statewide high school league is approximately normal with a mean of <math alttext="18.5" overflow="scroll"><mn>18.5</mn></math> feet and a standard deviation of <math alttext="3.2" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.2</mn></math> feet. Two students, Joshua and Mateo, from this league competed in the long jump. Joshua’s distance was <math alttext="0.52" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.52</mn></math> standard deviation below the mean of the distribution. Mateo’s distance was at the <math alttext="48th" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn><mtext>th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution.
content.question: At approximately what percentile was the distance jumped by Joshua, and how did his distance compare to Mateo’s distance?

choices.label: Joshua’s distance was at the <math alttext="30th" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mtext>th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution and was less than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the <math alttext="30th" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mtext>th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution and was greater than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the <math alttext="48th" overflow="scroll"><mtext>48th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution and was less than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the <math alttext="48th" overflow="scroll"><mtext>48th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution and was greater than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the <math alttext="70th" overflow="scroll"><mn>70</mn><mtext>th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution and was greater than Mateo’s distance.

content.answer: Joshua’s distance was at the <math alttext="30th" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mtext>th</mtext></math> percentile of the distribution and was less than Mateo’s distance.

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
